alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 1:53AM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches above 8,000 feet, except 18 to 36 inches above 9,500 feet in the Tusas Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph Tuesday and Wednesday. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed and icy road conditions, especially over higher mountain passes. Travel may be very difficult to impossible between Chama and Tres Piedras as well as from Chama to the Colorado border. Road closures may occur. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree limbs and lead to power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
